page.title: 12Farming - Spring to Winter
page.content: The layout of the milking parlour is known as a tandem system. It has three stalls down each side of a central pit in which I stand and from where I control the sliding door through which each group of three cows enter in turn. The teats of each cow are wiped with sterile paper to remove any dirt before the clusters are put on and the extraction of the milk begun by the suction equipment. whilst being milked each cow receives a carefully balanced ration of cow nuts which contain feed supplements and other trace elements to help keep it in good health and maximise milk yields. As the cows become dry, they are released in their groups of three and their stalls taken by the next three. They become used to this routine and instinctively know their order of entry to the parlour.
